. . . . the fur is growing on my wild mind . . . .

. . . . today my umbrella is this beautiful delusion . . . . .

. . . . some things you can't unsay . . . .

. . . . the closer to home the thicker the blur . . . . .

. . . . under the waterfall stalactites of light . . . . .

. . . . my skin is all pillow but I carry a cold thunder core . . . .

. . . . strange days you flip my up-side down . . . .

. . . . still love this dress but the belt has shrunk . . .

. . . . you stare at my hand's shadow like it's real . . . .

. . . . roll the poodles gently away from the edge . . .
